    Research Projects

    Mon., Nov. 29: Project Workshop

    • ‚ÄúSort and Filter Data‚Äù and ‚ÄúCalculate with Formulas‚Äù from Chapter 2: Strengthen your Spreadsheet Skills in Jack Dougherty and Ilya Ilyankou, Hands-On Data Visualization. (Optional lesson: ‚ÄúMatch Columns with VLOOKUP‚Äù)
    • Lesson: ‚ÄúIndexing, Slicing and Subsetting DataFrames in Python‚Äù Python for Humanities
    • Before you start this lesson:
      • Create a new working directory in working-with-data called python-humanities-lessons and create a new Jupyter Notebook in this folder called 02-index-slice-subset.ipynb. Use this notebook to go through this lesson.
      • Download and extract/unzip the zipped folder data distributed on Slack that contains the data files for this lesson, making sure the unzipped folder is in your working directory python-humanities for this lesson.
      • Read the two short sections ‚ÄúAlex‚Äôs Processing‚Äù and ‚ÄúOur Data‚Äù to get an introduction to the data you‚Äôll be using.

    In-class

    • Markdown Practice

    Wed., Dec. 1: Project Workshop

    • Complete the first three parts ‚ÄúFor loops‚Äù, ‚ÄúAutomating data processing using For Loops‚Äù, and ‚ÄúWriting Unique Filenames‚Äù from the lesson: ‚ÄúData workflows and automation‚Äù Python for Humanities (stop at ‚ÄúBuilding reusable and modular code with functions‚Äù).
      • Create a new Jupyter Notebook in your python-humanities-lessons folder called 05-loops-and-functions.ipynb and use it to go through the lesson.
